meanings.sent1: The unsubstantiality of the ghost made it seem transparent.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the unsubstantiality of the mist in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the unsubstantiality of the disappearing coin.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams felt like they were made of unsubstantiality, floating away when she woke up.
meanings.sent5: The unsubstantiality of the foam made it disappear as soon as it touched the ground.

meanings.definition: The quality of being insubstantial or lacking in material form.
meanings.sent1: The unsubstantiality of the rumor made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: The unsubstantiality of the cloud made it look like a fluffy pillow.
meanings.sent3: The unsubstantiality of the argument left everyone confused.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts drifted in a sea of unsubstantiality, never taking a solid form.
meanings.sent5: The unsubstantiality of the soap bubble made it burst with a gentle touch.
